item.name: SQLServer Backup/Restore Throughput
item.description: Read/write throughput for backup and restore operations of a database per second. For example, you can measure how the performance of the database backup operation changes when more backup devices are used in parallel or when faster devices are used. Throughput of a database backup or restore operation allows you to determine the progress and performance of your backup and restore operations.

item.name: SQLServer Connection Resets
item.description: Total number of logins started from the connection pool.

item.name: SQLServer Full Scans
item.description: Number of unrestricted full scans per second. These can be either base-table or full-index scans.

item.name: SQLServer Index Searches
item.description: Number of index searches per second. These are used to start range scans and single index record fetches and to reposition an index.

item.name: SQLServer Probe Scans
item.description: Number of probe scans per second. These are used to find rows in an index or base table directly.

item.name: SQLServer Range Scans
item.description: Number of qualified range scans through indexes per second.

item.name: SQLServer Workfiles Created
item.description: Number of work files created per second.

item.name: SQLServer Worktables Created
item.description: Number of work tables created per second.

item.name: SQLServer Worktables From Cache Ratio
item.description: Percentage of work tables created where the initial pages were immediately available in the work table cache.
